intro: Quercus rossii, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. The tree produces acorns that are enclosed in a cupule, a unique feature among oaks. It typically grows in dry to moist soils and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Quercus rossii plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
